description: Dropbox is a cloud storage service offering file syncing, sharing, and collaboration across devices with version control and robust integrations

tools.name: DROPBOX_CREATE_FILE_REQUEST
tools.description: Tool to create a new file request in Dropbox. Use when you need to request files from others by generating a unique link for uploads to a specified Dropbox folder, optionally with a deadline.

inputSchema.title: CreateFileRequestRequest

open.title: Open
open.description: Whether the file request should be open by default. If true, the file request will start accepting files immediately.

title.title: Title
title.description: The title of the new file request. Must be 1 character or more.

deadline.title: FileRequestDeadlineRequest

due_date.title: Due Date
due_date.description: The deadline for the file request. Timestamps should be in UTC. Example: '2024-08-15T17:00:00Z'

allow_late_uploads.title: Allow Late Uploads
allow_late_uploads.description: Specifies the policy for uploads after the deadline. 'seven_days' or 'thirty_days' allows uploads for that period. 'always' allows indefinite late uploads. 'false' (or not set) means no late uploads.

deadline.description: Represents the deadline parameters for a file request.

destination.title: Destination
destination.description: The path in the user's Dropbox where uploaded files will be saved. Must be a path starting with '/'. Example: '/Homework/math'

inputSchema.description: Defines the parameters for creating a new file request in Dropbox.

tools.name: DROPBOX_CREATE_FOLDER
tools.description: Tool to create a new folder at a specified path in Dropbox. Use when you need to organize files by creating a new directory. Requires the 'files.content.write' scope.

path.title: Path
path.description: Path in the user's Dropbox to create the new folder.

autorename.title: Autorename
autorename.description: If there's a conflict, have Dropbox automatically rename the folder. The default for this field is False.

tools.name: DROPBOX_CREATE_PAPER
tools.description: Creates a new Dropbox Paper document at the specified path using HTML or Markdown content.

path.title: Path
path.description: Path in Dropbox where the Paper document will be created. Do NOT include any file extension - Paper docs don't use extensions.

tools.name: DROPBOX_DELETE_FILE_OR_FOLDER
tools.description: Permanently deletes the file or folder at the specified path in Dropbox. Use when you need to remove a specific file or folder. Requires the `files.content.write` scope.

path.title: Path
path.description: The path to the file or folder to delete

tools.name: DROPBOX_GET_ABOUT_ME
tools.description: Tool to get information about the current user's Dropbox account. Use when you need to retrieve account details like email, name, or account type.

tools.name: DROPBOX_GET_TEMPORARY_LINK
tools.description: Tool to get a one-click temporary (expiring) download link. Use when you need to share a Dropbox file directly without proxying content through this service. Requires `files.content.read` scope.

path.title: Path
path.description: The path or identifier of the file to get a temporary link for. Supports Dropbox path (e.g., '/folder/file.txt'), id:..., rev:..., or ns:... notation.

tools.name: DROPBOX_LIST_FILES_IN_FOLDER
tools.description: Tool to list files and folders in a specified Dropbox directory. Use when you need to see the contents of a folder, including subfolders if recursive is true.

path.title: Path
path.description: The folder path (e.g., "/europe/invoices", "" for root) or folder ID (e.g., "id:aBcDeFgH123") to list contents from.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: The maximum number of results to return per request. Default is 2000. Max is 2000.

recursive.title: Recursive
recursive.description: If true, recursively lists contents of nested subfolders; otherwise, lists only immediate contents.

include_deleted.title: Include Deleted
include_deleted.description: If true, includes deleted (but potentially recoverable) files and folders in the listing.

include_media_info.title: Include Media Info
include_media_info.description: If true, includes media metadata (e.g., dimensions, location) for photo and video files.

include_non_downloadable_files.title: Include Non Downloadable Files
include_non_downloadable_files.description: If true, includes non-downloadable files (e.g., Google Docs, Dropbox Paper) in the listing.

tools.name: DROPBOX_LIST_FOLDERS
tools.description: Retrieves a list of folders, files, and deleted entries from a specified Dropbox path.

path.title: Path
path.description: Path to the folder (e.g., "" for root, "/folder/subfolder", or "id:abc123xyz"). If a path string, it must start with / and not end with / or whitespace.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Maximum number of folder entries to return per request; an approximate upper bound.

recursive.title: Recursive
recursive.description: Whether to include folders in nested subfolders (True) or only immediate subfolders (False)

include_deleted.title: Include Deleted
include_deleted.description: Whether to include folders that have been deleted but may be recoverable

inputSchema.title: DropboxMoveFileOrFolderRequest

to_path.title: To Path
to_path.description: Path in the user's Dropbox that is the destination. This path is case-sensitive.

from_path.title: From Path
from_path.description: Path in the user's Dropbox to be moved. This path is case-sensitive.

autorename.title: Autorename
autorename.description: If there's a conflict (e.g., a file with the same name already exists at the destination), have the Dropbox server try to auto-rename the file to avoid the conflict. The default is false.

allow_shared_folder.title: Allow Shared Folder
allow_shared_folder.description: If true, allows moving shared folders. The default is false.

allow_ownership_transfer.title: Allow Ownership Transfer
allow_ownership_transfer.description: Allow moves by owner even if it would result in an ownership transfer for the content being moved. This does not apply to copies. The default is false.

inputSchema.description: Request model for moving a file or folder in Dropbox.

tools.name: DROPBOX_READ_FILE
tools.description: Downloads a file from the specified Dropbox path, requiring `files.content.read` scope.

tools.name: DROPBOX_SEARCH_FILE_OR_FOLDER
tools.description: Tool to search for files and folders in Dropbox. Use when you need to find an item by name or content, optionally within a specific path or with other filters, and paginate through results. Example: Search for 'report.docx' in the '/finance' folder.

query.title: Query
query.description: The search string. Must be 1 or more characters. Queries are case-insensitive.

options.title: SearchOptions

path.title: Path
path.description: Scopes the search to the given path and its subfolders. Provide an empty string to search the root. If None, searches the entire Dropbox.

order_by.title: Order By
order_by.description: Specifies the field and direction to order search results by. Example: {".tag": "relevance"} or {".tag": "last_modified_time"}. Default is relevance.

account_id.title: Account Id
account_id.description: The account ID to search on. If not specified, searches the current user's Dropbox. Must be 40 characters or less.

file_status.title: File Status
file_status.description: Restricts search to files with the given status. Can be 'active' (default) or 'deleted'. To search both, omit this parameter or make separate requests.

max_results.title: Max Results
max_results.description: The maximum number of search results to return per request. Default is 100, min 1, max 1000.

filename_only.title: Filename Only
filename_only.description: Restricts search to only match on filenames.

file_categories.title: File Categories
file_categories.description: Restricts search to only match files in the given categories.

file_extensions.title: File Extensions
file_extensions.description: Restricts search to only match files with the given extensions (e.g., ['jpg', 'png']). This is case-insensitive.

include_highlights.title: Include Highlights
include_highlights.description: If true, highlight information for the matches will be returned.

image_content_search.title: Image Content Search
image_content_search.description: If true, performs content search within images for Business accounts.

options.description: Additional options for the search. If not provided, default search options will be used.

tools.name: DROPBOX_UPLOAD_FILE
tools.description: Uploads a file to a specified path in the user's Dropbox, with options for handling existing files.

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: Specifies how to handle the upload if a file already exists at the specified path.

mute.title: Mute
mute.description: If true, the user will not be notified of the new file via desktop or mobile notifications.

path.title: Path
path.description: Path in the user's Dropbox to save the file.

content.title: FileUploadable
content.description: File to be uploaded; supports various formats including images, PDFs, and text files.

autorename.title: Autorename
autorename.description: If true and a file already exists at the path, the new file will be renamed to avoid conflict.

strict_conflict.title: Strict Conflict
strict_conflict.description: If true, the upload will be rejected if the file already exists, regardless of the autorename setting.
